entry.title: 561: No CUDA for You!
entry.summary: NVIDIA locks CUDA down further, and we ponder what it might take to break their stranglehold on the market, Zuck's brilliant move that put an egg on his face, and we take a minute to appreciate new developments with Java.

entry.title: 553: Portably Predictable Productivity
entry.summary: We each bring surprise topics, a mix of hardware and software, as we prepare to hit the road for NixCon and SCaLE.

entry.title: 560: Artificial Information
entry.summary: Apple is pissed, and we'll dig into why. Plus, there are some big hints at Apple's AI plans; Meta's had a rough morning, and Sergey Brin popped back up at Google and proceeded to blow it immediately.

entry.title: 552: Plasma's Perfect Play
entry.summary: Plasma 6 is out, and we've been giving it a go. What's new, our thoughts, and the lessons other desktops should learn.

entry.title: 559: Double Botched
entry.summary: Why we're awe-struck by Google, and NVIDIA's CEO says no one needs to learn how to code anymore.

entry.title: 551: AI Under Your Control
entry.summary: Corporate AI is a hot mess, but open-source alternatives can be open-ended chaos. Weâ€™ll test some of the best ways to get local AI tools under your control.

entry.title: 558: Big Zuck Energy
entry.summary: We embrace the dad bod lifestyle and find out if Apple's Vision Pro demo sold Mike, and Chris is picking up on what the Zuck is putting down.

entry.title: 550: Ready Player Linux
entry.summary: Chris spends the week in a VR desktop, revealing the glitches, gains, and VR's open-source future.
